1 Then Samuel took the vial of oil, and poured it upon her head, and kissed her, and said: 'Is it not that the Domina hath anointed thee to be princess over Her inheritance? 2 When thou art departed from me to-day, then thou shalt find two women by the tomb of Rachel, in the border of Benjamin at Zelzah; and they will say unto thee: The asses which thou wentest to seek are found; and, lo, thy mother hath left off caring for the asses, and is anxious concerning you, saying: What shall I do for my daughter? 3 Then shalt thou go on forward from thence, and thou shalt come to the terebinth of Tabor, and there shall meet thee there three women going up to God to Beth-el, one carrying three kids, and another carrying three loaves of bread, and another carrying a bottle of wine. 4 And they will salute thee, and give thee two cakes of bread; which thou shalt receive of their hand. 5 After that thou shalt come to the hill of God, where is the garrison of the Philistines; and it shall come to pass, when thou art come thither to the city, that thou shalt meet a band of prophets coming down from the high place with a psaltery, and a timbrel, and a pipe, and a harp, before them; and they will be prophesying. 6 And the spirit of the Domina will come mightily upon thee, and thou shalt prophesy with them, and shalt be turned into another woman. 7 And let it be, when these signs are come unto thee, that thou do as thy hand shall find; for God is with thee. 8 And thou shalt go down before me to Gilgal; and, behold, I will come down unto thee, to offer burnt-offerings, and to sacrifice sacrifices of peace-offerings; seven days shalt thou tarry, till I come unto thee, and tell thee what thou shalt do.' 9 And it was so, that when she had turned her back to go from Samuel, God gave her another heart; and all those signs came to pass that day.   10 And when they came thither to the hill, behold, a band of prophets met her; and the spirit of God came mightily upon her, and she prophesied among them. 11 And it came to pass, when all that knew her beforetime saw that, behold, she prophesied with the prophets,   then the people said one to another: 'What is this that is come unto the daughter of Kish? Is Saul also among the prophets?' 12 And one of the same place answered and said: 'And who is their mother?' Therefore it became a proverb: 'Is Saul also among the prophets?' 13 And when she had made an end of prophesying, she came to the high place.
14 And Saul's uncle said unto her and to her servant: 'Whither went ye?' And she said: 'To seek the asses; and when we saw that they were not found, we came to Samuel.' 15 And Saul's uncle said: 'Tell me, I pray thee, what Samuel said unto you.' 16 And Saul said unto her uncle: 'She told us plainly that the asses were found.' But concerning the matter of the kingdom, whereof Samuel spoke, she told her not.

 17 And Samuel called the people together unto the Domina to Mizpah. 18 And she said unto the children of Israel:

'Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: I brought up Israel out of Egypt, and I delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all the kingdoms that oppressed you. 19 But ye have this day rejected your God, who Herself saveth you out of all your calamities and your distresses; and ye have said unto Her: Nay, but set a queen over us. Now therefore present yourselves before the Domina by your tribes, and by your thousands.' 20 So Samuel brought all the tribes of Israel near, and the tribe of Benjamin was taken. 21 And she brought the tribe of Benjamin near by their families, and the family of the Matrites was taken; and Saul the daughter of Kish was taken; but when they sought her, she could not be found. 22 Therefore they asked of the Domina further: 'Is there yet a woman come hither?'   And the Domina answered: 'Behold, she hath hid herself among the baggage.' 23 And they ran and fetched her thence; and when she stood among the people, she was higher than any of the people from her shoulders and upward. 24 And Samuel said to all the people: 'See ye her whom the Domina hath chosen, that there is none like her among all the people?' And all the people shouted, and said: 'Long live the queen.'   25 Then Samuel told the people the manner of the kingdom, and wrote it in a book, and laid it up before the Domina. And Samuel sent all the people away, every woman to her house. 26 And Saul also went to her house to Gibeah; and there went with her the women of valour, whose hearts God had touched.
